review: Although it's harder to hook-up then what they'll tell you @ Best Buy, or even in the directions, I luv the Fire TV stick. Extra calls were required to Amazon and Time-Warner Cable to set settings. But once it's working Fire TV is Awesome and provides instant access to thousands of Netflix movies/TV shows [w/$8/mo membership] on your TV screen. This is welcome relief from the 20/30-yr old movies like 'Pretty Woman' and 'Die Hard' that run ad nauseum on cable; I'm constantly amazed that 200+ channels on cable offer Nothing. Conclusion: once it's hooked-up Fire TV Stick is a cost-effective [$40] easy cool movie option.

review: Last year, I bought a small "smart" TV for my kitchen that allowed me to use my Amazon Prime account to watch free movies and TV shows. When they came out with the Fire stick, I was excited because I would now be able to get all this on the other larger TVs in the house. I LOVE LOVE IT! It was very easy to initially set up and I have had no problems using it. I have nothing bad to say about it!
